    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">link</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"src/prettify.css"</span> <span class="hljs-attr">type</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"text/css"</span> <span class="hljs-attr">rel</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"stylesheet"</span> /&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">script</span> <span class="hljs-attr">src</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"src/prettify.js"</span> <span class="hljs-attr">type</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"text/javascript"</span>&gt;</span><span class="undefined"></span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">script</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">style</span> <span class="hljs-attr">type</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"text/css"</span>&gt;</span><span class="css">
      <span class="hljs-selector-tag">body</span> { <span class="hljs-attribute">margin-left</span>: .<span class="hljs-number">5in</span> }
      <span class="hljs-selector-tag">h1</span>, <span class="hljs-selector-tag">h2</span>, <span class="hljs-selector-tag">h3</span>, <span class="hljs-selector-tag">h4</span>, <span class="hljs-selector-class">.footer</span> { <span class="hljs-attribute">margin-left</span>: -.<span class="hljs-number">4in</span>; }
    </span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">style</span>&gt;</span>
  <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">head</span>&gt;</span>

  <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">body</span> <span class="hljs-attr">onload</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyPrint()"</span> <span class="hljs-attr">bgcolor</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"white"</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">small</span> <span class="hljs-attr">style</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"float: right"</span>&gt;</span>Languages : <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"README-zh-Hans.html"</span>&gt;</span>CH<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">small</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h1</span>&gt;</span>Javascript code prettifier<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h1</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h2</span>&gt;</span>Setup<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h2</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">ol</span>&gt;</span>
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">li</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/downloads/list"</span>&gt;</span>Download<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span> a distribution
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">li</span>&gt;</span>Include the script and stylesheets in your document
        (you will need to make sure the css and js file are on your server, and
         adjust the paths in the <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>script<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span> and <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>link<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span> tag)
        <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint"</span>&gt;</span>
&amp;lt;link href="prettify.css" type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" /&gt;
&amp;lt;script type="text/javascript" src="prettify.js"&gt;&amp;lt;/script&gt;<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">li</span>&gt;</span>Add <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint lang-html"</span>&gt;</span>onload="prettyPrint()"<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span> to your
      document's body tag.
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">li</span>&gt;</span>Modify the stylesheet to get the coloring you prefer<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">li</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">ol</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h2</span>&gt;</span>Usage<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h2</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>Put code snippets in
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>&amp;lt;pre class="prettyprint"&amp;gt;...&amp;lt;/pre&amp;gt;<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>
    or <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>&amp;lt;code class="prettyprint"&amp;gt;...&amp;lt;/code&amp;gt;<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>
    and it will automatically be pretty printed.

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">table</span> <span class="hljs-attr">summary</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"code examples"</span>&gt;</span>
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tr</span>&gt;</span>
        <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">th</span>&gt;</span>The original
        <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">th</span>&gt;</span>Prettier
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tr</span>&gt;</span>
        <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">td</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">style</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"border: 1px solid #888;padding: 2px"</span>
             &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">name</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"voila1"</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>class Voila {
public:
  // Voila
  static const string VOILA = "Voila";

  // will not interfere with embedded <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"#voila1"</span>&gt;</span>tags<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>.
}<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>

        <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">td</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint"</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">name</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"voila2"</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>class Voila {
public:
  // Voila
  static const string VOILA = "Voila";

  // will not interfere with embedded <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"#voila2"</span>&gt;</span>tags<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>.
}<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">table</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h2</span>&gt;</span>FAQ<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h2</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span> <span class="hljs-attr">id</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"langs"</span>&gt;</span>Which languages does it work for?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>The comments in <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>prettify.js<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span> are authoritative but the lexer
    should work on a number of languages including C and friends,
    Java, Python, Bash, SQL, HTML, XML, CSS, Javascript, and Makefiles.
    It works passably on Ruby, PHP, VB, and Awk and a decent subset of Perl
    and Ruby, but, because of commenting conventions, doesn't work on
    Smalltalk, or CAML-like languages.<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>LISPy languages are supported via an extension:
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-lisp.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>lang-lisp.js<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>.<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>And similarly for
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-css.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>CSS<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>,
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-hs.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>Haskell<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>,
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-lua.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>Lua<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>,
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-ml.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>OCAML, SML, F#<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>,
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-vb.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>Visual Basic<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>,
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-sql.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>SQL<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>,
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-proto.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>Protocol Buffers<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>, and
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/source/browse/trunk/src/lang-wiki.js"</span>
     &gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>WikiText<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>..

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>If you'd like to add an extension for your favorite language, please
    look at <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>src/lang-lisp.js<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span> and file an
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://code.google.com/p/google-code-prettify/issues/list"</span>
     &gt;</span>issue<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span> including your language extension, and a testcase.<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>How do I specify which language my code is in?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>You don't need to specify the language since <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>prettyprint()<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>
    will guess.  You can specify a language by specifying the language extension
    along with the <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>prettyprint<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span> class like so:<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint lang-html"</span>
&gt;</span>&amp;lt;pre class=&amp;quot;prettyprint <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">b</span>&gt;</span>lang-html<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">b</span>&gt;</span>&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
  The lang-* class specifies the language file extensions.
  File extensions supported by default include
    "bsh", "c", "cc", "cpp", "cs", "csh", "cyc", "cv", "htm", "html",
    "java", "js", "m", "mxml", "perl", "pl", "pm", "py", "rb", "sh",
    "xhtml", "xml", "xsl".
&amp;lt;/pre&amp;gt;<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>It doesn't work on <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>&amp;lt;obfuscated code sample&amp;gt;<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">tt</span>&gt;</span>?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>Yes.  Prettifying obfuscated code is like putting lipstick on a pig
    &amp;mdash; i.e. outside the scope of this tool.<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>Which browsers does it work with?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>It's been tested with IE 6, Firefox 1.5 &amp;amp; 2, and Safari 2.0.4.
    Look at <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"tests/prettify_test.html"</span>&gt;</span>the test page<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span> to see if it
    works in your browser.<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>What's changed?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>See the <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"CHANGES.html"</span>&gt;</span>change log<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>Why doesn't Prettyprinting of strings work on WordPress?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>Apparently wordpress does "smart quoting" which changes close quotes.
    This causes end quotes to not match up with open quotes.
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>This breaks prettifying as well as copying and pasting of code samples.
    See
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"http://wordpress.org/support/topic/125038"</span>
    &gt;</span>WordPress's help center<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span> for info on how to stop smart quoting of code
    snippets.<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span> <span class="hljs-attr">id</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"linenums"</span>&gt;</span>How do I put line numbers in my code?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>You can use the <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>linenums<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span> class to turn on line
    numbering.  If your code doesn't start at line number 1, you can
    add a colon and a line number to the end of that class as in
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>linenums:52<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>.

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>For example
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint"</span>&gt;</span>&amp;lt;pre class="prettyprint linenums:<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">b</span>&gt;</span>4<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">b</span>&gt;</span>"
&amp;gt;// This is line 4.
foo();
bar();
baz();
boo();
far();
faz();
&amp;lt;pre&amp;gt;<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>
    produces
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint linenums:4"</span>
&gt;</span>// This is line 4.
foo();
bar();
baz();
boo();
far();
faz();
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>How do I prevent a portion of markup from being marked as code?<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>You can use the <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>nocode<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span> class to identify a span of markup
    that is not code.
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint"</span>&gt;</span>&amp;lt;pre class=prettyprint&amp;gt;
int x = foo();  /* This is a comment  &amp;lt;span class="nocode"&amp;gt;This is not code&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;
  Continuation of comment */
int y = bar();
&amp;lt;/pre&amp;gt;<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>
produces
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">pre</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint"</span>&gt;</span>
int x = foo();  /* This is a comment  <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">span</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"nocode"</span>&gt;</span>This is not code<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">span</span>&gt;</span>
  Continuation of comment */
int y = bar();
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">pre</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>For a more complete example see the issue22
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">a</span> <span class="hljs-attr">href</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"tests/prettify_test.html#issue22"</span>&gt;</span>testcase<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">a</span>&gt;</span>.<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>I get an error message "a is not a function" or "opt_whenDone is not a function"<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">h3</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">p</span>&gt;</span>If you are calling <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>prettyPrint<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span> via an event handler, wrap it in a function.
    Instead of doing
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">blockquote</span>&gt;</span>
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint lang-js"</span>
       &gt;</span>addEventListener('load', prettyPrint, false);<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">blockquote</span>&gt;</span>
    wrap it in a closure like
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">blockquote</span>&gt;</span>
      <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"prettyprint lang-js"</span>
       &gt;</span>addEventListener('load', function (event) { prettyPrint() }, false);<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>
    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">blockquote</span>&gt;</span>
    so that the browser does not pass an event object to <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span>prettyPrint<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">code</span>&gt;</span> which
    will confuse it.

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">br</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">br</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">br</span>&gt;</span>

    <span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">div</span> <span class="hljs-attr">class</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"footer"</span>&gt;</span>
